keyTakeAways: A fuel tanker overturned and exploded in Niger State, Nigeria, killing at least 35 people.
The explosion occurred after the tanker spilled petrol, which ignited following a skidding incident on the road.
The Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) reported the incident and confirmed the death toll.
Several injured individuals were taken to the Federal Medical Centre Bida, suffering severe burns.
Niger State Governor Mohammed Umaru Bago expressed deep condolences and highlighted that people approached the overturned tanker to retrieve its contents.

The chairman of the Niger State tanker drivers’ association, Farouk Mohammed Kawo, stated the tragedy was 'devastating and avoidable' and attributed the high accident rate to the 'deplorable state of the road'.
The tanker was transporting petrol from Lagos to northern Nigeria.
At least 30 crashes have been recorded on the same route in October alone, indicating a dangerous pattern of road accidents.
Poor road conditions, including potholes, are a major contributor to accidents involving petroleum transport.
Nigeria’s reliance on road transport for fossil fuels due to a lack of pipeline infrastructure increases risks of such incidents.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A fuel tanker transporting petrol from Lagos to northern Nigeria overturned and exploded in the Katcha local government area of Niger State, killing at least 35 people and injuring many others. The crash occurred after the vehicle skidded off the road and spilled petrol, which ignited. The Federal Road Safety Corps confirmed the incident, while Governor Mohammed Umaru Bago expressed deep condolences, noting that some people had approached the overturned tanker to retrieve fuel. The chairman of the Niger State tanker drivers’ association, Farouk Mohammed Kawo, said the tragedy was avoidable due to the deplorable state of the roads. The incident highlights Nigeria’s vulnerability to deadly road accidents due to a lack of pipeline infrastructure and poor road conditions, with at least 30 crashes reported on the same route in October alone.
title: Nigerian fuel tanker explosion kills 35, road safety agency says
